featured.text: As many as 60 pilot whales swam ashore.
In the five years since his heart transplant, he had been on an exercise program where he regularly rode a bicycle for five miles, swam each day, and walked a couple of miles.

However, each time he lost a dove into the cold water, and—with the help of her competition, his coaches would lock him in a cage sister and two men—swam and pushed the boat for for days, feeding him only coffee and bread.
The 60 pilot whales swam ashore as a result of (A) a large winter storm off the coast of Cape Cod. (B) a behavior currently unknown to scientists.

definition.zh_def: 游泳的過去式，指在水中用手腳推動身體前進的動作。
definition.en_def: The past tense of swim, meaning to move through water by using the limbs.
definition.example: She swam in the lake every summer.
